text: I love Duke's! One of the best neighborhood bars I've ever been too. Great bar food and good wait staff keeps me coming back. In addition to the karaoke and bingo on Thursdays!
Server was an ass, left before we even ordered. I know Dukes does not care, because they were busy. They won't ever miss my business, and they will never get it. F, you to the ass server.

Great food, burger was awesome!  Sirloin salad-fantastic!  Friendly staff, 18 year anniversary party, Marley Taylor rocked the house with live music!  This place has it all, sports, patio, dance floor and super menu!

This is a great all-around "go to" place. You want to grab a bite or a cold one with a old friend, or a (very) casual first date with a new someone? Tastey food, reasonable prices, decent service, sports all over the place, pool in the back. In a town where douchebag nightclubs come and go faster than imaginable, theres a reason why Dukes remains.

The owner is (for lack of a better phrase), a business-incompetent jerk.  I will NEVER return to Duke's. There are amazing restaurant choices nearby that I highly suggest everyone support.  Bad business should not be encouraged.

A bunch of Co workers and I went here for lunch thinking of breaking the normal lunch time routine.  Well the experience was terrible to say the least.  Our waitress lost our simple order and came back to us a half hour after she took our initial order to admit it.  Things happen, Its understandable.  But another half hour goes by with  no signs of our food or even a heads up when it might be coming out. Now we are late coming back from our lunch break and we just wanted to pay for our drinks and go. We felt as it was forced upon us to stay and did not feel like it was right.  So long story short. She did not give us any discount on her mistake,  they gave us to go boxes.  Messed up everyone's order in the to go box,  and each paid 13 dollars for a lunch that tasted so un-cooked that half of us ended up throwing it away... If you do go here..  Just make sure you have plenty of time to hang out.

Used to be our favorite sports bar but last time we had a waitress with a bad attitude and was not even cute, looks like a meth head!! Dont they know if they hire good looking girls with a pleasant attitude, they will get more customers, going elsewhere, dont need service with an attitude!!

Headed to Dukes to watch the Montana football game as they have a satellite they show the game with. The past few years we have been fortunate enough to see the game at home on Root Sports or Altitude.  This is one of the weeks the game was on neither. So off to Dukes we trekked from Glendale. First of all when the game is on at noon you should not be waiting till noon to find your satellite feed. As  we have gone  sporadically in the past 5 years this has become the norm. Wait till noon to find the game. Spend the entire 1st quarter trying to find the game. Someone finally hooks their computer up and we see 30 seconds of game and 10 minutes of buffering.  Don't plan on watching the game if you are expecting to. The owner should be offering a discount to all who sat there that ordered food and drinks. Not my idea of watching a game at a sports bar. I will say the food and drinks were great as usual.  Believe me I have eaten there more than once without being able to see the game. I also see you have removed all the booths and put in foosball tables leaving 
even less seating. Might I suggest moving your pool tables into that same room and putting all those tables into the middle room which is much lighter and would provide more seating . Also you might want to think about upgrading your satellite if you are going to consider yourself a site for Montana football.

Not a bad spot.  They have a pretty decent selection of beers on tap, for reasonable prices.  Plenty of TV's.  They have two rooms of pool tables, with more tables than the majority of bars in Phoenix.  Most importantly, they have all of the sports channels.  As a Boston fan, this is the only place that I've found that has NESN.  They are very willing to put on a dedicated TV for you if you ask...not always with sound, but it's better than nothing!  Plus, there usually aren't too many college douche-bags there, so it's generally a chill atmosphere.  Also, their back patio is awesome, as it looks out onto the greenbelt, rather than a parking lot like most places in the valley.

Dukes Well Vodka got me sick?? I never get sick from drinking, if you go there Don't order any well Drink from Dukes. I called management after getting sick and to let them know they might have bad well Vodka, and the Manager Al kept making excuses on how I got sick and started to argue with me. He didn't even say sorry. I won't be going to Dukes any more and if you go there hopefully you don't get sick too, Jaime!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I can't bring my bottle of water in because it's a health violation? Dafuq? 

You can't give me both fries and tater tots with my burger? Dafuq? 

Your system can't split our 3 pitchers of beer between 2 people? Dafuq?

I have my favorite servers. Great service, love my Tuna Steak Cesaer salads! Thanks for caring: Jesse, Jenifer, Shawn, Megan, Monica, and cooks Jesse and Jason who do the best job of cooking the Tuna Steaks. To make it perfect, make the Tea stronger and the Ranch dressing thicker.

Like seemingly every sports bar that exists, has ever existed, or will ever exist (in this reality or those realities of the alternate variety) this place is pretty average, decent, perfectly fine, OK.

I mostly come here for the trivia and to grab a beer or two.

The food is fine, typical pub fare. Nothing special or particularly impressive, but gets the job done if that's what you're looking for.

Not a place I'd go to if really wanted a nice meal and super tasty food, more of a drinking, watch a game, play some shuffleboard type of place. Same as any other sports bar.

Now that the head chef went to another restaurant the kitchen is disorganized. They knew tonight would be a busy night with the asu college game but they still ran out of the daily special. I think this is piss poor management from an owner who has supposedly been in the bar business for 30 plus years. Maybe he should pay more attention to his business instead of if he has a full drink in front of him. The servers are great and friendly. The bar would be dead if it wasn't for his daughter running this place during the day. On dozens of occasions a random non-Arizona sports game has been on the main screen instead of the diamondbacks or coyotes game. This might as well be a dodgers home city bar because the dodgers are always on the big screen. When we ask the bartender if we can watch the diamondbacks they say the owner is at home watching the bar on security cam and wants the dodgers on. Does he think the dodgers will bring more business? 
Lol...forget ever coming here if you are a  hockey fan. The owner hates hockey and it's never on the big screen. This bar has only survived this long due to the area lacking good restaurants. Hopefully that'll change soon with the new development happening on McDowell. The only reason I come back to this place is because it's within walking distance. He needs to remember that there's  more on than shitty Montana football.

I've been going to Duke's for a long time. The service is decent and the food is average. But recently something made me decide never to go again.

A few weeks ago, I was sitting at the bar and I noticed that there was one girl there who is an LA Kings fan. It was the night that the Kings eliminated the Coyotes from the playoffs. She was (needless to say) excited. She didn't appear drunk, nor was she obnoxious nor taunting the many Coyotes fans. However, I witnessed the owner demand her to leave. I felt this was unfair, as it seemed the only reason he had was simply because she was cheering for the opposing team.

I've been to Dukes when the Lakers were the star attraction, so you can't tell me that this is an "Arizona" bar. She was treated unfairly. Period.

Because of this fact,I will not be back. There are far too many other sports bars (with better food, better service, and may I say better hospitality).

THE WORST BAR FOR DRINKS........stay away from this place.  The food is very bad and greasy and don't complain because you will get asked to leave... the owner is a complete jerk and drunk most of the time.... if you go stick to the beer the bartender has no idea what she is doing...The places is filthy....just go when the lights are on!
Well so far this is my favorite spot to go. Staff is friendly, even to me. And food is good, California burger with potato salad. My new go to food.

We used to love going to Dukes on Wednesdays for trivia.  Then they changed their menu, increased their prices, and didn't change the level of service.  I've never been treated so rudely as I was tonight.  I will not be returning to Dukes.

If you like the elderly and are not a minority its the place to go!  
If your too loud they kick you out or come over and tell you to be quite.  
Not the place for people looking to have fun.

I come out to Scottsdale every year in March for one weekend, to do two things: to watch spring training baseball and watch the opening rounds of NCAA March Madness all day at Dukes.  And it's heaven.  The service at Dukes is friendly and attentive, they have good bar food, and a bloody mary station to get you going in the mornings.  They have more tvs set up than you could possibly ever need, with multiple rooms that cut you off from the main bar area so you or a group can watch your own game on a big screen with volume.  It's a real sports bar that knows how to run it's tvs and put the best games on.  They have multiple pool tables, buck hunter and shuffle board.

No stars even though the wings are very good.   Are they worth 12$ per order of 10 ?  I don't think so.  We went in to watch a game. Just me and my two boys.  Each had a order of wings and fries.  They kept bringing us refills throughout the game (not telling us they were a 1$ each for refills.  Over all for some wings and fries  and multiple refills that were a DOLLAR each , our bill for lunch of wings and fries was over 65$.  Are you FUCKING shitting me ?  Service was slow at best.    It's such a shame.   Good wings just to get shit on.    Don't think I'll return for that kind of abuse.

From my door, it's a five minute stroll through the greenbelt to Dukes. They have a nice patio. They have enough TVs to show all MLB/NFL/NBA games. They have plenty of shuffleboard and pool tables. Yet, I've only been to Duke's a few times and I am not going back. This place is just bad.

Mixed drinks use cheap mixers (such as bottled sour mix for margaritas). They offer a pretty basic beer selection at a rather high price point. I think PBR pitchers might be more modestly priced, but that might be only when they're on special.

The food is pretty bad, even for bar food. And pricey. Sure, the menu is gigantic and I've tried many different items, but I didn't find anything good. Everything seems to be made from freezer-to-fryer or packaged products. I'm not exaggerating: the burger and fries for about $8 is a thin, previously frozen patty with a handful or supermarket fries. I could go on about salads, sandwiches, and ribs. In the same price range, you can get a much better version of anything on the menu at Four Peaks or Zipps or even Devil's Advocate.

One of the owners was there on a few occasions. I guess being the boss of (and drinking in) his own bar is some sort of dream of his. He treats the place like his kingdom. He'll ask patrons "how is everything?" and get mad at them if they have anything negative to say. I feel bad for the rest of the service staff; they seem to be above average, but when the overall situation is this bad it just doesn't matter.

In this city, sports bars are a dime a dozen. I'd rather go elsewhere.

Finally a place to watch local sports with sound.  I always find it unbelievable that many sports bars here in town look past our local teams and support the foreign hoards from Wisconsin, Minnesota, NY, Illinois etc..  Not at Dukes...local first.

Please return to your frozen tundras and leave us with the Suns, Cardinals, Devils and Coyotes.

The food here is nice bar/pub fare and is always fresh and hot.  Drinks are plentiful and service respectable.  Would like to see a little more variety on the taps but other than that Dukes is a great place to catch a game.

The beer was not cheap, and the food was horrible. I'm pretty sure it was frozen food they heated up in the microwave and sold to me for like 12 bucks. What a scam!

The only reason I don't give it 1 star is this would be a fun place to go to hang out and watch a game or play pool, but don't expect it too be cheap. I think you could get cheaper prices on Mill or Old Town.

Such high hopes I had for Dukes.  Opening night of the NFL...exitement is high, the place is packed.  We're eating, drinking, watching the game, the crowd is into it, when mid way thru the 3rd quarter, a microphone comes on interferring with the NFL broadcast, announcing its time for TRIVIA!!!!   WTF!!!!  Its opening night of the NFL and you're holding a trivia night!!!!!  Unf***king believable!!  This is a "SPORTS BAR"?????  I mean...what can I say!!!  I'm so tired of "sports bars" playing karaoke, holding trivia night or playing music while the SPORTS are on.  We immediately closed our tab and left.  The most pathetic part was that the waitress advised if we moved to the back where the pool tables were, we would not be able to hear the trivia!  How 'bout you move the trivia back there and let the NFL fans watch the damn game!!!  Very, very sad.  Sports bar??? HA!!  What a joke!  BTW, my wife ordered the "full" order of ribs, expecting a full rack, but recieved what would be considered a "half rack" anywhere else.  On top of that, she said they were the worst ribs she ever had.  Just sayin'.

Today was my first visit to Dukes.  The location isn't idle, kind of off the beaten path, but upside... easy parking.  The atmosphere is great... exactly what you want out of a sports bar.  Lots of seating, lots of tv's, lots of pool tables... easy to get a beer.  I would recommend it for anyone looking to watch a game or have a beer at a chill spot.

Been coming to this place for years! Food is not the greatest, but the wait staff is awesome and really take care of you.  Pool tables, darts, and air hockey keep you entertained while you enjoy drinks from the bar.  Trivia seems like lots of fun, but for me, I frequent Dukes for the karaoke on Saturdays. The good Dj's allow for lots of fun all night long.  There is lots for the sports bar lover to enjoy here!

I love this place! It's right down the street from our house, & we come here almost every weekend. It might not be the nicest looking place, but the food is awesome & the waitstaff is great. Their prices are also great, & I love that they have pool tables. Yes, the interior could use some updating, but I think the datedness adds to the charm.  If you're looking to uppity snooty Scottsdale, this isn't the place for you... But if you're looking for laid back people, good food, & good prices, this is the place.

Hello my fellow yelpers, please take the time to read this yelp because I'm going to expose the truth about the establishment..

I used to be a employee here at this establishment and I regret it. The food was terrible, the staff was rude and disrespectful(except a few) and the owner.. Don't get me started on how much of an a hole he was. 

Now I'll start with the food, working at this establishment, the food took forever to cook.. I would ring in a simple salad and not get it for 20-30 mins.. Now it doesn't take that long to make a salad, the coordination and the communication was terrible.. As a server we would always have a pager on us when the food was done, and there were time food would sit in the window for a long period of time.. Because the cooks wouldn't page us.. Now that being said.. I would ask the cooks to remake my food.. But I guess reheating it in the microwave counts as a "remake". Now Dukes signature dish I would say would have to be the wings.. Now, I've eaten alot of chicken wings and this place they're disgusting.. All they do is deep fry them and then extremely sauce them and give them to the customer.. You can say it was more sauce than wings.. Which would incline to a terrible stomach ache the next day.. Another this is alot of the apps were already pre-made.. Other than the mozzarella sticks, everything else was store bought.. The hummus, the cheese, onions rings.. Everything. Do don't be fooled when they say it's all homemade.. Pfft yea, and pigs fly. Also don't go on a busy day either and order food because as I said ealier, you'll wait up to an hour just for your appetizer..


Now for the staff, 
Let's start with the bartenders.. 

MEGAN- very welcoming, very nice and has a great personality.. If it wasn't for her I would of never stayed because she had a heart and that's what defines her. 

MONICA- She was ok, I would ask her something and she would give me a straight answer.. Now when I requested a drink from her.. Yea it took awhile to get my drinks..but she's eh ok. 

Monique- was there to work and Always gossip about everyone . I hated that about her.. She was always gossiping like a 12 year girl alway talking about someone If it was either a customer or even An employee..like it was some kind of reality TV show. I always came into work thinking it was high school again because I felt bullied. 

Mark- oh mark.. This man was in a "management" position and was terrible at it.. He would always flirt with the girls, giving them free shots and would rather Stare at a pair of boobs than help his fellow Co workers out.. He was always an a hole to the other workers (other than the girls). As an example, I would ask him for a drink.. His response..no. Or yea hold on.. Then he'll "playfully" laugh and say, just kidding.. Like no you weren't.. I heard him talk rude to customers, I heard him make comments that were disrespectful.  So if you go to Dukes and see mark working.. I advise.. LEAVE! just turn around and leave 

Now finally Rebecca (crow) she's like Megan, she was nice and very informative.. She always had answer to my questions..so I don't have any thing to say about her.. 

Now finally the wait staff.  
Just a heads up, you walk in there, the majority of the waitstaff are either high, or extremly rude.. There are a couple female staff are just there to work.. Rude to thier tables and rude to their fellow employees.. Like honestly if you see an ad for this place.. DO NOT APPLY!!!!! Unless your a total B*tch or a stoner.. Because that's all what Al seems to hire.

Now to the owner-
AL. Word of advice.. DO NOT GO TO THIS BAR WHEN THIS MAN IS THERE!!!! And you'll know it's him because he's either yelling at someone or the only drunk ass old man there at the bar. This man has terrible.. Terrible.. Terrible managing experience.. You get hired the first thing he says is.. Your my family and I treat you like family.. HA LIES. I've seen this man grabbed and PULLED one of the servers hand and yell at her because there was a napkin on the floor.. This man only has three computer systems and  he's yelled at people for not using the one in the area. He's yelled at people for not having drinks on the table when they just sat down..hes very judgemental...towards other people.. You walk into the bar wearing cowboy stuff prepared to be yelled At to leave.. Or even shoved out. Because this man will lay his hands on you, if he doesn't like you, he's even layed his hands on the waitstaff thinking it's ok to shove your finger into someone chest or to grab some girls arm and pull her away to yell at her because there is a napkin on the floor.. One of these days he's going to do that to the wrong person and he's going to lose that bar..

Although we've been here many times in the past (and enjoyed the experience), I was very disappointed to see the menu recently has been streamlined.  The server told us that someone new is now running the kitchen, and has simplified the menu to focus on quality.  Not impressed.  The hamburger that I order came on a kaiser roll that tasted as though it had been pulled out of a bag of rolls.  The "pound" of wings that my son ordered cost us $11...can find less expensive and better wings at BWW, Zipp's or even Barro's Pizza.  Very disappointed with these changes in food quality and pricing.  To add insult to injury, we were there today on  NFL opening weekend.  The place was packed, which added to a wait time of over 30 minutes for pretty mediocre food.

Accidentally stopped in on my way to the mountains. .what a wonderfully fun accident it was!..I enjoyed great food,people,laughter, and fun...I played darts,pool...and absolutely enjoyed the atmosphere here...I will make it a planned dinner and fun place to hang in the future..fabulous!

Well Condor and The Duke go way back, but Sunday was the first time I went for "Brunch".  After vigorously exercising along the Scottsdale greenbelt with Scraps, the Wonder Dog ("SWD"), for over 10 minutes, we ascended to the patio at Dukes. While I recovered from the workout, Angie, the pet friendly waitress, attended to SWD with ice cold agua fria. The Breakfast Burrito with chorizo was the next undertaking and it was muy bueno. Although no sports were on that early (well the Indy 500 was on, but that is just driving and I can do that locally), the Patio at Dukes was the perfect place for an early morning for a Man and his  Dog.
Place has really gone down hill,  is it pretty much a dive bar now w/ prices to match the Scottsdale club scene w/ service nearly nonexistent, do yourself a favor stay far away from this s*!t hole

I used to come here a lot about 8 years ago. I loved all the staff and the food so I figured it wasn't going to be much different and was excited to be back. However my server Paula wasn't very attentive and didn't seem to care. I am a server and a bartender and have been for 10 years so I know the industry very well. She didn't seem happy and I had to get her attention to call her over numerous times, she never asked how our food was; which we didn't like (we got the chicken fingers). I asked for 2 things of blue cheese and 1 more ranch for the chicken before we tried it, they cost .75 each mind you; we tried the chicken and didnt like it so we asked for something else which she got for us but still charged us for the dipping sauce we didn't even use. I think she should have taken them off my bill since they never got used, but I guess she needed the money. I left her a 15% tip when I shouldn't have left anything, the service wasn't good and the food wasn't good. If I ever do come back I'll just sit at the bar and make sure I eat before I come.

Just there for game 7 of World Series, an historic event either way, yet they have no volume or low volume for the game.  They have some trivia guy yelling at full volume but are unable to get game volume.  They also had rodeo and other bs on tvs not realizing the importance of this game.  I gave up a long time ago but gave a second chance tonight.    Won't be back for anything important.   I could imagine what they would do for a Super Bowl. ...  Loud Kareooke? ????

Not a Sports Bar.  See elsewhere.

As a sports bar with a SB menu it a good set up if you like this kind of fare. Unfortunately they only serve conventional brand beers instead of local and or regional mircro beers. So if you like the corporate brand beer and basic sports bar food you'll be fine. Staff is cool and they offer a ride home service if you need it.

The owner "Duke" pops in for a few and will talk to customers.  I stopped in only because it was in walking distance from 3 palms hotel i was staying at.

This is what you call a real sports bar. TVs are lining the place with every sport showing on tv. There's a wide range of seating inside and on the outside patio. There's darts, pool, shuffle board, arcade games, and probably more. Friendly staff and good service. The food is your average bar food with reasonable prices. It's a great place to unwind and catch a game. Bonus... They have a giant sign above the bar that reads "Cowboys Suck".

I feel like such an idiot - we tried this place when we first moved here, walked in, then walked right out.
7 months later, we say "hey, let's try this place Dukes ! Never been there "

I groaned to my self when we walked in "you IDIOT". This place still sucks. 

OK , we wanted to see game 3 of the Heat-Thunder finals, and guess what the audio was in the bar ? A frikking GOLF tournament ! Can you say LAME ? 

So we walked in and politely asked these 2 scummy 20-somethings if someone was sitting on the table between them and the big screen showing the bball game (which also overlooked the temporary kiddie play area with about 8  6 year olds having a birthday party - egad) 

One of them said "yea, they're free, if you don't block my view". I glared at him with my best  "as if..." look (he was puny). So we sat down, I looked at the kids, then my wife, and we both said 'let's go back to Majerles", so we left. 

I just don't like the layout of the place, it's got awkward and uncomfortable seating, and the absolutely worst thing about this dump ? 

Kids-in-the-bar. Yes, there are kids in the big section off to the right.  I don't go to a bar that allows kids (Zipps in N. Scottsdale does and they're off my list, too)

Anyway, there are TONS of better bars around town and I dunno, the place just gives me the hibbidy-jibbidys for some reason...

Great neighborhood sports bar. Wonderful staff and decent food. My faves are chicken cordon blue sandwich and western burger. Good soups and nice salad selection. Avoid the onion soup - no onions and cold cheese on top.  Overall though a great place and nice food!
Great drinks. Terrible food. About what you expect in a sports bar. It's got a nice view being on the green belt.

Been going to the bar and grill for 6 yrs I will never return to this place again. Today my wife and I with our lab sat on the patio had a drink and ate lunch. I got up went to the men's room came back to my table paid the bill left a tip as usual . I stood up to leave when the owner got in my face screaming at me !! He was holding a beer and you can tell he had to much to drink. He was yelling at me at the top of his lungs to get the hell out of his place and never come back. I had my side arm on my hip. Been going there with it on my hip for the last 4 yrs never had a problem . I always look for signs that say no firearms allowed . I have never seen one posted anywhere. He stood there inches from my face yelling at me. Great way to treat your customers . Screaming I don't want packers here!!!!! So I guess I'm a packer fine I am using my constructional rights. I told him if this is his he treats his clients that I'd never return. He said fine I won't let your kind in here. Then proceeded to yell get the fuck out of here!!! I turned and said don't worry I'm not ever coming back to this place. Then yelled what are you going to do ?? You wanna pull in me. I said are you fucking nuts!!! He kept screaming as I walked away.  Sad he could not had been civilized and walked up to me and said sir I guess you did not know we don't allow guns in here. Please do not bring it again. But no he had to be abusive and very mean. This is precisely the type of person I try to stay away from. Reason being they are unstable and you just don't know what they will do .  When he asked me to pull on him this told me just how disturbed this man is. He should be ashamed of himself. I wear the gun to protect myself and other people from crazy nuts like him. I respect the law and abide by the law .
Good ribs and bar food. Great staff! Leave a little extra time if you are pressed for time at lunch though

this place pretty much fits the bill for what you expect.  beers.  lots of pitchers.  they even have some device that i haven't seen before to actually keep your pitcher cool while you're drinking away.  club sandwiches, burgers, fries and lots of televisions with just about every possible sporting event showing within your view.  i wouldn't say it's incredibly impressive or the clientele is going to make your jaw drop so you don't necessarily need to drive all over town to get here. but if you're in the neighborhood and need to quench your thirst with a basic selection of beers and kill that pang of hunger with serviceable food while watching the game on solid, average-sized screens then this place will suffice.  this place values consistency over being stellar and i guess there's nothing wrong with that.

Greatest sports bar in PHX and maybe the world.  COWBOYS SUCK is written above the bar.  TVs everywhere, tolerable food, and a great make it yourself Bloody Mary bar on the weekends.  Dog friendly, cool staff. Awesome park right there also.

Not too bad of a place but...how in the hell do you charge for coke refills...$1.....seriously? You can't possibly need the money that badly! I'd give it no stars just for that reason alone. And this is coming from someone who has owned 15 restaurants at one time. So, I know the drill and rarely complain about restaurants.

Literally, was here for 2 hours before everyone at the table got their food. Server was rude, manager was rude. The manager Marcia literally said "I can do a cart wheel and the splits". I felt mocked, I came here for awesome bar trivia with Darrell, but unfortunately I won't be back. Hopefully the manager and the serving staff gets their act together.

I have to let the public know the Salmon at Dukes is amazing, you will thoroughly be satisfied !!!! Never dry, over cooked, &  litely seasoned to perfection, the digestion and flavor is certainly hard to distinguish from the wild salmon where I lived in Northern British Columbia, Canada!!!!!  Seafood Salmon LOVERS  THIS IS A FOOD THAT YOU WILL CRAVE !!! Ummm try it I've never been disappointed ! 
Thank you Dukes I had a relatively quiet .....relaxing dinnerawesome conversation with Scottsdale City Employee,  a disc golf tournament player, &  great staff !!! ..I  look forward to  nites as this !  Thanks

Bottom line:   the food is nasty.

My wife ordered something and then went to the rest room.   With in the 2-3 minutes she was gone the food was waiting for her.    It was terrible.    I can see this being a decent place for beers and a game but do not eat there.

Dukes is a solid sports bar with a low key vibe and friendly staff. My only complaint is as a DD; they not only charge $4 for a soda but $1 a refill. Most bars don't charge for soda, especially for DDs.

Great place good food and fast service! I would like to say my wife got harassed by one of the gym trainers from across the street while she was waiting in her car in your parking lot, we no longer feel like we can go here safely without being approached and questioned by a bodybuilder from pt by joes when I just wanted a burger.
Always fun and the food is great! Family used to come here all the time, especially for trivia nights lol.

The bartenders are the only reason I listed this as a two star, I've had several issues with Dukes and honestly I've given too many second chances. Monica is the best bartender in the valley and is totally worth it a visit. The food not so much and the waitresses are garbage, they cuss customers out and ask for Id's just for water and the manager laughs in people's faces.

First I must say Todd is great! However the nachos are weird. I expected real cheese and it's covered in nacho cheese. No mention of this fact on the menu otherwise would not have ordered. I used to get REAL nachos here all the time. I think you should warn a person if they are about to order nacho cheese. Just sayin! Guacamole was good though, no surprises there.

We had a great time playing trivia. The man running the trivia show was really sweet. I wish they had the trivia question on the TV screen. That was the only thing that I would say. It was a lot of fun going to a bar and having entertainment for two or three hours. Much more interesting and fun then  just sitting there drinking

Stopped by Duke's this morning after finding positive reviews on Yelp. The food was decent enough, but I was ignored by the waitstaff after I was given my food. It took over half an hour AFTER I was finished eating to flag someone down to get my check. It would be one thing if the place was super busy, but there were only two other customers in the entire building. Definitely not worth it, and I would probably only go back if I was in a group.

If I could give less than 1 star I would. I just moved here from another state and decided to try Duke's for dinner. Instead of having dinner, my night was ruined. As we sat down the waitress asked us what we wanted to drink. Everyone at the table ordered water. She then asked for ID because "you have to be 21 to be in here". She did not say "21 or with an adult or guardian". She wouldn't serve us or even discuss what our situation was without sending a manager over. I am 25 and legal guardian of my 16 year old sister who was with us (she was the only under aged person). sitting next to us are two adults with their young child. The manager, Mark, was 10x worse than the waitress. He was a smart ass and after hearing our issue, he laughed and said "why do you come here then". This place is absolutely awful. Never in my life have I been treated this way at ANY customer service based place of business. Disrespectful, out of line, judgmental and rude don't even begin to touch on the service we got here.

This is a great restaurant/bar!  I usually go with my boyfriend but sometimes we bring our kids AND our DOG!  When there is no kids with us, we sit inside and watch sports with TV's everywhere!  If kids are with us, we can enjoy playing some of the games that are separated from the bar (darts, pool, shuffle board, etc.).  And we especially love going with our dog on the patio.  They bring water bowls and treats out for them and there is usually other people with their pets as well.

The food is really good!  I love the Ruben and their Jamaican Salad but honestly, I haven't had anything I didn't like.  Plenty of beers on tap.  Prices are good. Restaurant is always busy and laid out nicely.

And finally, if you've had too much to drink, they have a free cab service right outside the bar.  You can't beat that!

Great place to watch games and drink. Lots of tvs and I'd say the food is on the better side for a sports bar.  They have phone chargers and the service is usually timely.  If in the area I would check it out.

Dukes is hands down my favorite dive bar in Scottsdale. I have had some major life events take place at Dukes, including a boyfriend dropping the "L bomb" for the first time. How romantic, right?! 

Anyway, I always have a good time at Dukes. They have about a million TVs, pool tables, shuffleboard, darts, Buck Hunter etc... Definitely a little something for everyone! I find their drinks very reasonably priced - it seems like they always have specials on beers and shots. 

The food is pretty decent for bar food. I'm a big fan of the buffalo style wings, they're nice and big and juicy. Nom nom nom! 

Dukes also provides a free cab service if you happen to indulge in too many spirits. Don't drink and drive, y'all!

My only complaint is that once or twice I've caught some attitude from a bartender, but that's probably a fluke and service is usually fine for a dive bar.

It is just down the street from me but as far as food goes it is just okay...

The reason the rating is so low is due to the fact that we were there to watch the Finally Four and during the same time they decided to also make it trivia night?!? It seemed that everytime one of the teams would make a break they would also be yelling out another question, totally a distraction. Not a good move for a SPORTS bar.

The night started at Dukes. It was bigger and cleaner than it looks from the outside and offers an impressive range of salad. Yes, I had salad at a dive bar and I do not regret it. I also had beer, and a vodka cran on the house for whatever reason. I must say that I like Dukes. Ok, it will not become my go-to but if I lived close enough, I would be a regular of sorts. 

Small stuff that I really enjoy, is the fact that you can borrow a phone charger (you have to give up credit card for trade) and have it charge your phone while you do whatever you do. Small stuff that I find very cool.

Also they have this cool anti-drink&drive policy where they take you home if you are inebriated. I don;t know the details, but the fact that there is one is very cool. Very very cool 

In the end, it's a like a divey sports bar. And that is OK.
I used to really love this place but its getting more and more expensive and the service in the tables is slacking sometimes. Good game coverage but the prices are steep.

Duke's is my place to grab some lunch when I want to get away from the same old grind of a sandwich. The food is okay and has always been fresh when I have eaten here with co-workers. The hot wings, burgers, sandwiches, and salads are all pretty good!  It is a sports bar so if you are wanting to do an intimate lunch or want to speak without having to raise your voice a bit. This would not be the place for you. If you are a sports junkie than this is the perfect place for you to come and relax and watch various sports on there 15+ televisions and have a cold beer.
They have an all new menu, totally fresh! No more freezer food, and they have Orange Shandy on tap! I'm in heaven!!!

typical bar food,  not fantastic but edible.  probably frozen then cooked at order.  great patio overlooking green belt.  Ashley and I stopped there on bike ride to lake by ASU.  Played frisbee  in green belt below patio after brunch.  cool place to stop. lots of televisions inside but did not go inside.

I will try to be constructive with my critique of this place.   The food was average.   I did not care for the zucchini.  The Philly Cheese Steak did not have much flavor.  Everything tasted like frozen microwave food.   Furthremore, the service was not very good.   Our server was very forgetful and non-attentive to us.   I have no reason to ever come to this place again.   I will not provide a recommendation for this place.

The service is hit or miss. Just like the food. 8 out of 10 times the burgers are excellent but then they lack consistency. A few times they've screwed up the order and sometimes it's overcooked. They could offer onion rings as a side with burgers instead of a $10 appetizer. That would be nice. When it's busy this place seems to fall apart badly. They really have some servers who try and do their best but you can tell management and leadership is lacking. The owner is often here drinking but I've yet to see him lift a finger to help service expediting food or getting drinks for people when the bar and wait staff is clearly buried.

Great place to watch any sports game.  They have TV surrounding the place, it gets loud when a big games are on.  But great food and drink specials.  Try to get there early, sometimes you can't find a parking spots if you go late.
The wait staff is amazing and the food is good, but God forbid you're in here when the owner is getting drunk. He runs people out  a lot if they get in disagreements...

Good deals on certain days for food. Large selection of sports to watch on the various tvs. The patio setup is great in the fall/winter but brutal during the summer months. The service staff is attentive and take orders as soon as you sit, but I wish the menu had more variety.

Duke's doesn't have the best food or beer in town, but the patio is dog friendly which is neat!  I have brought my Boston Terrier - BUDDY here a few times and we both like it!  The clientelle at this bar is very "old school" and mostly "older".  The nachos are really good and the CHILI CHEESE FRIES are quite good also.  They have kilt lifter on tap and a pretty good selection of other beers.   It's fun to look out onto Vista Del Camino Park at the passers by as you nibble on your food and sip your ice cold beer!!  Everytime I see Duke's I think of Fraiser's Dad from that TV show and he the name of HIS bar was also "Duke's"

Lame.....................

So I was looking for a good dive bar near my house. I am not talking Apache Rd in Tempe divey, where the patrons could possibly stab you, but a good low key hang out. I need a Cheers.

When I read the Michael C.'s great review that said they have free car service to pick you up and drop you off I thought I had found my place!

OH how I hate being wrong!  I went here with a friend Saturday night, after waiting 30 minutes for the car to pick us up, the driver told us he had no change so we could tip him. So we ended up giving him in a tip what a cab would have cost us. It was obvious he was scamming us, but what is the point of confronting him? I needed him to take me home later.

Now this one won't be a negative for the guys, but there were way more chicks than guys. I prefer a few more guys in a bar.  But I guess the biggest missing element for me was fun people to talk to. I love going to a bar with a friend, having a few drinks, and meeting fun people to talk to. Those people weren't here. It was a weird crowd, and not in a good way. One weird solo guy at nearby table was actually leaning in and listening in on our conversation, then he would make comments out loud, but to himself, about what we said. His back was to us the whole time. The whole thing was a little One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest. The music and the karaoke were entertaining, but I prefer a bar that has interesting people who you want to meet.

The waitress was almost completely devoid of personality. The little that was there obviously hated being at Dukes! She sucked, and she screwed up our bill.

One lady who worked there named Cynthia stopped by for a minute, and she was cool and friendly. Thanks for the 5 minutes of friendliness Cynthia!

Another negative was the brightness of the bar. Hello, bars should not be that bright. You needs just the right combo of alcohol and dim lighting to meet your future ex-boyfriend.

Just an overall disappointment! Unfortunately, I won't be back there anytime soon.

Server was awful. I asked for wine and the server said they didn't have any . I looked at the table across and two people had wine. He didn't know the beers- we knew more than him. He took our order and brought out our food, but left without leaving us silverware or condiments. My salad was watery and tasted terrible . We had to ask other servers for things we needed. The waiter also took my drink before I was finished . Overall horrible, horrible service .

This place is great. I had the spicy burger (it had some clever name but I don't remember what it was) and a local draft beer. The burger was phenomenal. The service was really great the bartender Monica was really gracious. 

They have Karaoke if you are into that kind of thing

Not a bad place, service is a bit spotty, but otherwise good.

No doubt its a huge place with a ton of TVs and good food, great place for sports fans! Cowboys fans beware!!!

Stop in and cheer for favorite team.
The service was responsive and friendly.  I love watching sporting events here. This is my number 1 place to go for watching games. Friendly and fun atmosphere!

Ok. I had two five dollar gift cards and decided to try some food and a beer. I still refused to order any of their thirty salads, but I did try the $8.45 grilled buffalo chicken wrap and it was better than expected, but still three star material. The buffalo sauce had a good kick and the chicken was grilled strips - it was all stuffed into a tortilla with grilled onions and a few peppers and lettuce. They forgot my side of dressing and the fries were standard frozen, but crisp and the slaw was good, but not homemade. They serve late, so if your in need, try the wrap, you will be filled up. Couple bucks less and it might have been a value deal.

Rude waitresses. Bad service. Microwave tasting food. Seems like it would be fun if the food didn't taste like garbage and the help was pleseant. It smelIs bad inside, kind of like vomit. I love dive bars but this place has taken it too far. I will never ever go to this place again and I would not send my worst enemy there. May God have mercy on Duke's soul.

Typical sports bar, in dire need of some redecorating! This place looks (and smells) like 1974, nix the HD tv's. Its an OK place to meet a pal for a beer, but no dates, or it'll be your last date with that Gal!

So, stopped in for lunch today. First time, and the last time.  Sat at the bar, service was good.  $3 for ice tea, my brother also ordered an ice tea. Another $3. 

I asked for a refill, Jackie States $1 refill. For damn ice tea.

Tell you what, the minimum wage law kills business, but for lunch, $31 dollars later (chicken strips and a club sandwich) I'll frequent other places in the area.

$7 for tea. Unreal.

Good ol' Duke's! This place is a standard for us. We go there often and LOVE trivia with Darel! Service is hit or miss. Some times we have great service, other times it is dismal. Prices are decent and it is a fun atmosphere. It is a good local spot with staff you will recognize. BTW, this is where I had my first date with my man, so that gives it four stars!

Great place to go play pool! They have nice tables, shuffleboard, and TV's. The service is great. The food is pretty good for bar food. The nachos are on point! They have a nice patio outside. If you are into frisbee golf there is a great course right next door. You can stop in for a beer halfway through the game if you want. They have good happy hours. The best part is they give you a free ride home if you had a couple too many! They do pool tournaments from time to time and they are always doing specials on the weekends.

I don't know why I kept going back to this place. First of all if you go there you will probably get bad service. They have two people that work their that are good, the rest of the staff is horrible. They are remodeling the place, they need much more than a remodel.  The owner needs to take responsibility of his establishment and not let his staff run his restaurant. Remodeling isn't going to improve sales it's the staff.  Have I mentioned how bad the staff is there. Could be a great place but no one cares there. Don't bother going to this place. I would love to see it go under and have some new take it over that actually cares. Go to pranksters, much better service.

Decided to try this place for Super Bowl. Seating was OK and some TVs didn't have best clarity. People were there to watch the Super Bowl, yet they didn't have all the TVs tuned in for it. We asked, since the ones over the bar had every other TV on another station and it was distracting. Waitress said they are a sports bar so they needed to play any other sports on TV. Watching a story about Allen Iverson or Curling was not worth even having on, but they wouldn't change the stations.  Ordered Chili Cheese Fries that come with cheese and onions. Our server asked if we wanted cheese and onions?!?  So what are chili cheese fries without the cheese? They came, cold and without onions.  I ordered ice tea and found out that refills cost money. Who does that?? Asked for dessert menu and was told they don't serve any desserts because their kitchen is too small. The owner, I presume, had the nerve to ask if we wanted dessert because we don't drink?  People who drink, eat desserts. Not a place I will go back too. Wasn't impressed, at all.

Regular sports bar with a couple of unique amenities.  Large patio on the Scottsdale greenbelt.  Menu where every sandwhich has a corresponding salad version (essentially replace the bread with lettuce).  Lots of specials, and a fun birthday offer.  It's quite large with multiple sections, and televisions all around.

The menu of salads is expansive!! And on Wednesday nights they have a special on the salads for I believe around $6.50. They also have sandwiches, drinks and an outdoor patio. I was really impressed with the salad I had.. I know salads are hard to get wrong but it was a big heaping portion of greens with yummo fried chicken atop and a bonus that I happened to go on a Wednesday night for the special. (: 

I know this place is popular, they stay open until about 12A every night and serve food very late. Millions of TV's, seating and a chill atmosphere.

I haven't had a drink there but am definitely thinking about it next time before I hit up Old Town Scottsdale since I live nearby.

So sad to write this but it needs to be fixed ASAP! Please have a manager !!!

Past few times horrible service . We won't see our server for a very long time and won't get drinks unless we start another tab at the bar .

Honestly -anyone - just stick with sitting at the bar . It's very hard to track out anyone for a meal,drink or bill.  ( and it's not that busy )

Sad .not sure if we will be back for awhile .

This place is great! We needed a late night dinner and the menu was impressive for being 10pm on a weeknight. The food was really good and it wasn't just standard bar food. My buffalo chicken sandwich was huge! A very generous sized chicken breast with lots of fixings. I look forward to coming back the next time I'm in town.

What's not to love? Outdoor patio where my dog hung out while we watched football, great drink prices, yummy sandwiches and we really loved the wings! We are visiting from out of town and we like it so much we will be back for MNF tonight.
This place has decent coverage of the games. Waited what seemed like for 50 minutes for nachos. Let's get it together.

Atmosphere was great for watching football,  service was good and a Bloody Mary bar was a treat.  We had a group of 8 and a nice table to converse.  My beef is with NOT informing us that the 18% gratuity was included.......therefore I tipped another 20%......sb the responsibility of the staff to remind us.....shame on you!!!   I won't be back!

This sports bar is a real sports bar with a menu that has your awesome bar food with other healthy options. I am gluten free and had the best BBQ bacon cheeseburger that had a gluten free bun! It was so amazing! The staff is friendly and the drinks are always on the ready!

Arrived at 11:30 on a Wednesday and ordered promptly.  It took 30 minutes for a salad and a french dip (and they weren't very busy).  The fries were cold.  The sandwich was cool.  The au jus was hot enough to burn my lip, thereby rendering the whole thing inedible until it cooled.  The ranch was so runny it was like water.  And, to top it off, got a touch of food poisoning.  Won't ever go back!

This is your typical sports bar with mediocre fried food options, but it is great for watching the game as they have a plethora of televisions. They could use to clean it up a little bit as it feels a little dirty. However the owner loves to give out free shots when his teams play.
Great place! Excellent service and food. Very comfortably back patio. Gone back several times

I came in on a Wednesday night for trivia and had a pretty mediocre time. Six of my friends all met to eat, drink, and have a good time, but service kind of ruined it for us. I was sharing pitchers of beer with three other dudes and it was all I could do to get more beer. It took about thirty minutes to flag down the waitress and then get the next one delivered. Half an hour with nothing to drink.
Add to that that our food took a really long time too. Now, it being trivia night i was prepared to cut the kitchen some slack... But our food came out an hour after we ordered it and it was cold. Even great food isn't that good cool cold and this was just standard bar food. 
The trivia on the other hand was a high point. Their announcer is clear and repeats stuff often enough that everyone gets it. The trivia is diverse and interesting and I felt like everyone had a chance to win it. (We got third!) 
Ultimately however, we brought a designated driver because we wanted to drink and we left pretty sober.

I'm slowly becoming a Thursday night regular here. Although I am not 80 years old, I do thoroughly enjoy Bingo night. It gets me to focus, it makes me EXTREMELY competitive (like seriously, I will bust the table over if you sit next to me and win) and well, I love the chance at winning cold hard cash (read: $5).

But Bingo aside, Duke's isn't a bad place to roll into. They have a pimpin' ride right outside the bar that will take you home (fo' free) if you get too drunk and cannot drive yourself home. This is becoming quite the trend for sports bars in the valley and although I don't know how often they get used, I still thoroughly applaud and support this trend to prevent drunk drivers out there.

Alright that's enough of my sob stories. Lets talk about the food. Thursday night has rack-of-rib special for $8 which is a great deal. If you are a healthy eater like me, the menu has like 20 salad options. HOWEVER, note that the salad options kinda go like this "caesar salad, chicken caesar salad, prime rib caesar salad, salmon caesar salad, cobb salad, chicken cobb salad, prime rib cobb salad, ....". So, they're not particularly delicious, but if you get prime rib on a salad for the same price as just the salad (sans the prime rib), I would call that a decent deal.

For the sports lovers, let me just say that this is as sporty of a sports bar as it gets. There are TVs everywhere and you will hear the bell chime every time there is a TD. My favorite is the giant screen TV in the tiny tiny women's bathroom: so, if you are alone there and are ballsy enough to pee with the stall door open, you can watch your favorite team while making more room for your beer. Creepy? A little. Cool? Very. 

A solid 3 stars for effort and a decent atmosphere. An imaginary +1 for the hot Michigan fans there. Not that i'm partial to them or anything... :)

We were riding the Scottsdale trail with our granddaughter and stopped at our half way point to eat lunch. It has now been an hour and we are still waiting for our food. I understand that the Montana Football game is their busiest day, but seriously. Plan ahead and work at full staff. This bar is huge inside and I'm sure it's packed. We opted to eat in the patio and every table is full. Good thing we packed some string cheese. Very disappointed in the service. We were here 2 weeks ago on Sunday after riding and really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. May rethink this spot. Portillos sounds really good right now!!

The staff was personable and attentive, even when the Steelers lost AFC Championship :( Bartender has a good pour and drink prices seemed little less than base price of "call liquor" in Scottsdale. 
The food I did sample was just good enough, not great.
All in all though super chill, where nice people wait on nice people who come together for fun, food and drink!

I like going to dukes! I think it's a really fun environment and has good bloody Mary's which are hard to find in Phoenix. 
I've been there maybe 10 times and only once did we get decent service. If it's busy when you get there, expect to ask for your server, as they won't notice you for 30 minutes or more. Once, we had a group of 6, and the waitress finally came by and brought us fries. When we had eaten half the fries and she returned, she said "who ordered these?" We had all assumed one of us did or she brought them over as an apology for the wait. Wrong! She grabbed them and scolded us for eating another table's fries. The one time we received our food within a normal time frame and had a polite server, made a world of a difference. This won't prevent me from returning for a game and a bloody, but Id go there more if the service improved.

Dukes more like Pukes. 
Positives-
AVG food and Descent service
Negatives-
This place is dirty the chairs were dirty and the glasses and cups were old and dingy. My friend was given and Ice holder that keeps the beer in the pitcher cold and it was broken and looked old and NASTY.
Also a weird crowd with very little scenery, if ya know what I mean. Won't be back!

I went here on a Friday night for trivia and the place was packed.  They have a lot of pool tables, shuffle board and a million TVs.  Everything you could ever want in a sports bar, right?  Well here is what you don't want. It is SO loud in there you can barely have a conversation.  Our server was missing most of the night and when he did show up he screwed up our orders.  

I give it three stars, 1 for the wall of TVs showing different games, 1 for the menu that has a lot of variety including 2 pages of salads, and finally 1 star for the fact that they have a bloody mary bar.  This alone will get me back in there to watch football on a Sunday morning.
Great atmosphere, but!! It took an hour and 45 min to get our food. The one star is for the amazing service our waitress gave us. I felt bad for her that the kitchen was so slow!! Thanks Megan.

This is one of my favorite hang out places. If you want good beer, good company, and great service this is your place. Super friendly staff, has great wings and tater tots as well as shuffle board. Great atmosphere to be in for a chill Friday night

I am not usually the "sports bar" type, so the first time I went to Duke's, it was because of a friend's recommendation for the food.  The daily specials are quite a steal and since we went on a Saturday, getting a decent ribeye for less than $9.00 seemed like the way to go.  We enjoyed the meal, had the patio to ourselves and it was a lovely day.  When we cashed out, the server gave us a birthday postcard to fill out, so we did.  Last week, my fiance received his, so we decided on going Saturday so he could have the ribeye.  This time, we sat inside because it was a bit cool outside.  A bit loud and way too much basketball, but hey it's a sports bar, right?  Again, the food was good, especially considering their really low prices.  My guys vodka tonic wasn't up to par, but all in all, we enjoyed the experience and will go again next month for my free birthday meal.

The food is better than typical bar fare - my husband and I both enjoyed the food - but I cannot recommend this place because we had such a bad experience here. 

This was our first visit to Duke's on McDowell Road, which is pretty close to our home. Great location for a sports bar and a cool place to watch sports on a hot summer day in Scottsdale. 

We went to Duke's to watch Game 7 of the NHL Western Conference playoffs, and the owner refused to put it on in the main part of the bar, despite multiple customers' requests.

He told hockey fans to go to the pool (billiards) room to watch the game. No one went.

As we were leaving, my husband told the owner that we would have stayed longer if we could have heard the game. "What do you want to hear, the puck going into the net?" he says, laughing at us. And he tells us, "See ya later," telling us if we don't like it we can leave. Who does that??

We weren't asking him to turn off the Dodgers game. We wanted him to turn off the sound for baseball and turn ON the sound for hockey.  

We'll never go back to Duke's. Scottsdale has many other, better choices.

Trust me, I have all sorts of love for dive bars. But this one is just not on my list. We used to play trivia here and that was a good time. Other than that it is an easy place to pull up to on a bike off the green belt.

It's a great local spot, and is exactly what you expect of it. It has a ton of TVs, good bar food, and great prices. I suggest this for a laid back night, or to watch a game. They'll accommodate most requests on one of their many TVs.

Great service! Fish tacos are fantastic.  My son had wings and loved them.  Great bloody marys, nice portions, not too big or too small.  Very reasonably priced.  Near the green belt so eat, drink, walk..;)
This place is a lot of fun, attentive staff, cheap (or free) pool. Reasonably prices drinks!
I'm a big fan of this place. Great service, good prices.  It's a nice sports bar atmosphere.
Down in Scottsdale on business, this was the after meeting place.  Great ribs, shrimp, salmon, and sliders.  If the carried Bud light on tap, I would give them 6 stars.

Wings were solid, big and cooked well.  Chili was decent with lots of cheese.  Southwest burger was cooked nicely, mayo on the bun was a mistake.  Tater Tots were crispy.  Beer menu could have used some more craft beer but I'm splitting hairs here.  Good joint, will be back.
I absolutely love this bar! Here once a week if not more. My parents love when they visit from Cali and come on trivia nights. My pup loves the patio as well.
service is hit or miss but amazing sports bar.  No DUI taxi and the owner is big cards fan.

Not a fan of the food
However, I do appreciate that they have a LOT of salads on the menu!
Yay!

This is a good neighborhood bar.  If you're looking for trivia, karaoke, cheap happy hour drinks and you live in the neighborhood.... GO!

If you don't live in the neighborhood, don't bother.
We were very pleasantly surprised when we had lunch here last Thursday. The bartender was super friendly and attentive and our food was delicious! Very good experience!

Very welcoming staff! Great tap list and inviting environment. Had the Hess ipa solid local beer. The fish and chips were great highly recommended. Rebecca and Jackie were the best! I can't wait to come back.

My friend just moved in to the apartments next door and got a $25 gift card so we decided to check it out. I was more than pleased with the atmosphere and friendly staff. The food is delicious and very reasonably priced. Wednesday and Friday are trivia nights and I will definitely be returning to enjoy!

Great spot, friendly staff, good food and drinks with a ton of TVs, pool tables, darts, fooze, buck hunter etc.  Reasonable prices and open floor plan.  Great friendly atmosphere and like the other reviews report its not a "Scottsdale scene", this is where you and your friends go for a beer, to watch a game, shoot some pool (or fireball shots..maybe both), or stop in midway through a disc golf game.  Patio is dog friendly so weekends its a great place to walk and enjoy a beer with other dog lovers.  This is a great spot for a casual night with friends, trivia on wed and Fridays is better then most places trivia (actually challenging general knowledge not just filled with crap pop culture questions, its actually good for all ages). One of the few true sports bars on the east side of town.  The owner AL is there most times and takes great pride in his bar and sponsors allot of local teams and charity events!  

Food Review (Updated 1/22/16): Well when I had written the original review they had just redone the whole menu and everything was fresh way above expectations for a while.  Although I still go there all the time and love this place I felt I need to update the food part as it was not accurate any more.  The food is still way better but has slipped back to above average bar food, and in the Scottsdale market with gastro pubs and sports bars everywhere if your just going for a great food experience there are allot of choices specialize in food. If you want a great neighborhood sports bar with good food and tons of TVs this is your place.  Quesadilla, Egg McDuke Burger, Chicken Tenders, are still my favorites.

FAMILY?: During normal lunch and dinner hours it is fine for a family but if you take your kids to watch a football game at a bar on Sundays maybe you should read some more parenting books and not be mad that its a BAR environment (a few of other reviews complain about not kid friendly during football, personally i hope they don't come back as they really mess up my football experience giving me dirty looks when I curse the Damn Packers... its a sports bar people).     

FOOTBALL:  DA BEARS!!!!
Unlike zips and other venues in Scottsdale you can actually watch all the games at once there is a wall of tvs not just scattered tvs.  Get there at least 30 min before your game on Sundays as it fills up and you need to snag a table or grab one from people leaving from prior game.  It is a go to football spot for most people in a 5 mile radius.

Who is warming up to Dukes? This guy!

Been in more frequent and I must say the place is looking great. Updates to TVs to start and the staff is on point. Great/ quick/friendly service all make me rethink why I haven't been hanging out here more often.

I really like the food, everything has been great in the last few months, but my favorite dish is the shrimp platter.

If you like subpar bar food and service that takes forever, come to Duke's.

The one redeeming quality is the dog friendly patio, it's a pretty large patio as well. Inside there are tons of tvs, pool tables and they even do trivia multiple nights a week. 

When I've eaten here however, I haven't really been that impressed. I've always never chosen this place, my friends did because they live walking distance from it. Duke's a 2.75 Star restaurant to me... not awful but definitely not something worth traveling for.

The menu is a vegetarian's nightmare. You are pretty much stuck with either nachos (does not include beans) or a veggie burger (obvious microwaved boca burger). They do have shuffle board, but you have to pay, and its timed, so make sure you pee prior to dropping in your quarters because you got maybe 15 minutes to bust that game out or your screwed.

We stopped in at this bar on a Friday afternoon after realizing that the gluten free bakery in the same shopping center had closed it's kitchen. We were seated outside on the side patio. We enjoyed our view of groups playing Frisbee golf and people out enjoying the beautiful day. The food was pretty mediocre. We started with the fried zucchini appetizer. I ordered the veggie burger sans bun with fries for my entree and my sigo had the Philly Cheese steak sandwich with Au Jus. My "burger" came with a measly piece of lettuce so I asked for extra which I don't believe we were charged for. The food we had was just OK.

Go here if you:
Like to watch sports
Don't like to wear anything fancier than a brand new T-Shirt
Just want to chill out
Hate to dance
Like pool
Like beer

Don't go here if you:
Take 2 hours to get ready to go out
Drink fine wine when you go out
Can't decide whether PCL or Dirty Pretty is your favorite bar
Expect a DJ
Don't like an age diverse crowd

This is an awesome spot to grab a beer and watch the game.  The place is generally full of people that are similar in tastes.  I am not sure if I would classify this one as a dive bar, but it does have somewhat of that feeling.  It is also a lot bigger than it looks from the street.  If you like sports bars and are nearby, it is a must to try it.

I'm not even a big fan of sports and this is easily my favorite bar. The prices are really cheap for a bar and the food is good considering it's just bar food. They have daily specials including a day where you can get a two dollar hamburger with fries. This means its a real hamburger, not a tiny little thing. My mom and I can share it. 

Pool, Shuffleboard and Darts are available as well as other games. Electronic cards and racing. The service is always amazing even if theyre very busy. I've never had a bad waitress here. 

The best part is that they have a giant private room and guess how much it is to rent it out? It's completely free. You just have to book it in advance. They could have easily charged a lot for that private room since it includes its own shuffleboard and pool table. 

Also they have a FREE designated driver who will take you home. All they ask is that you tip them. There's no reason to ever go anywhere else.

Great little neighborhood bar (my cousin loves this place). It's huge with great vibes - everyone is friendly. Their beer selection is a bit lacking (I'd like to see a few options other than the normal Bud, BudLight, and a few "crafts"). Food is pretty good.

I'm not a fan. Other than one cocktail waitress the service has been RIDICULOUS.  Most of the food I have had is pretty gross, wings were ok. The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because they have free pool nights.

They make an awesome prime rib steak salad for 8.75, I love there tuesday special, prime rib steak with fries and salad for like 7 dollar, but you have to order a drink to get the special, so i order a bottle water, still a great deal. The steak is very tender and Duke's only use the best meat, plus they only use non transfat oil to cook all there food. Duke's kind of health councious on how they cook things. But eating a burger is still bad for you, but at less they are trying to keep it more natural.
It's up and it's good!  The best sports bar in town.  Friendly service, fairly priced food, excellent game day atmosphere.

When the bartender says it sucks, then the place must really suck.  A group of us went here on a Wednesday night and we were told that this place was really bumping before.  Two churches close by complained and the original owners picked up a left for a new location.  So whatever you heard in the past probably don't hold up to what it is now.  My co-worker that saw this place in the hey-day was really disappointed.

Came here after flying into town on business.  The girl at the front desk of our hotel recommended this place.  There was some disc golf event going on so it was very busy.  It took about 45 minutes to get menus and waters after we had already been seated.  We ordered burgers and sandwiches and some beers.  The beers came out pretty quickly.  We waited about an hour for our food.  My French Dip was good and the burgers were good, according to my co-workers.

I cannot give this place more than three stars due to the fact that grabbing a quick bite turned into a two and a half our ordeal.

I've come to Duke's a lot for carryout orders later in the evening, probably 50 plus orders. They are open during hours many places are closed which I love. 

However, while they claim the kitchen closes at midnight, bar at 1AM, the last couple times I've called in they've closed the kitchen well ahead of midnight. This gets frustrating as a frequently returning customer who enjoys their select group of late-night food options.

I will no longer be going to Duke's because of this, sadly. They have some good food options and their attempt to be available later in the evening is wonderful but inconsistent.

I am very convinced that there is no such thing as a sports bar with good service in Scottsdale.  Dukes is no exception.  

I went to Dukes last Sunday for the Chargers game and it was packed.  I was pretty happy to see a sports bar within stumbling distance to my house that was actually a lot bigger than it looks from outside.  Sure, its in a strip mall but I can overlook that.  

What I cant overlook is how downright miserable our server looked when she was actually anywhere near our table, which wasnt often.  I almost deducted two stars for this, since other friends of mine had been there the day before and said their service from another girl was equally as poor.  

What I do like about Dukes:

Cheap drinks
Bloody Mary bar
A billion TVs
Shuffle Board
The layout and big space
Free Wi-Fi (No I did not take my laptop, but for those fantasy football players that must have their scores immediately, it seemed like a good thing)

All in all, a good place to watch the game, whoever youre cheering for.  Maybe service at the bar (instead of at a table) is better.

Cool staff, nice place and some tasty foods.  There are two parts I am having issues with however.  

First they had a free driver service for many years and it says they still have it on a few pages.  Not so and I am upset they did not have the foresight to update things once they changed the service.

Secondly were their ribs.  They tasted great!  There were some disgusting fat nodules though and the bones were oddly cut.  That cut down the enjoyment however for me.
Good sports bar.  It was Thurs and they ran out of the rib special.  Salad was good.! Beers are cold.

Great sports bar.  Plenty of seating, plenty of tvs, and dog friendly patio.  Nice selection on menu with daily specials, they sometimes run out of menu items which isn't cool but there are plenty of other good selections.  Try the chicken breast with mashed potatoes and green chili gravy...yum.

We came in to watch the GRIZ play as the owner is from Montana. This place is dingy, dirty, and has horrible service. I've never been to a bar that charges for refills. Not a fan of this place. Not sure why people come back.

Stopped in this place as it was very close to my hotel. Had an Ice Cold Beer, and good service at the bar area. In addition as it was Monday night they were doing a special on their basic burger or a pork tenderloin sandwich for $4.00. 
I chose the PTS and it was pretty good, not amazing mind you, but tasty and the price sure was right. It was served with nice crisp and hot fries, and it hit the spot perfectly.
I would recommend this place if you are looking for a quick bite to eat and a cold drink. Plenty of TV's as well for your sports watching needs.

Hidden in a random strip mall, there's a good chance plenty of people pass Dukes without realizing that they are missing out. Now, this is a dive bar so like all other dive bars, you have to take it for what it is. The floors could be shinier, the bathrooms could be cleaner, but then it wouldn't be an authentic dive bar would it?

Duke's is a solid choice when looking for a place to play some bar games, watch sports and enjoy some drinks. It's spacious and great for large groups. You name the game, they've got it: several pool tables, darts, shuffle board, Foosball, etc. TVs line the walls with your favorite sport teams playing. With the reasonably priced drinks, this is a good place to pregame before a sporting event or set up shop and watch it on TV. 

I've hosted a party at Dukes and it's a perfect location because of the size, TVs, games and most importantly, because they don't charge to rent out the party room. So, you can have up to 100 people in a party room without any fees! And, for a girl on a budget trying to throw a low key party, this was a perfect choice. 

So I suggest Dukes if you are looking for a dive bar night on the town and you don't want to just sit around when you get there.
Love this place! Erica is the best!! She makes the best margaritas! Can't go wrong! #teamerica!!!
Come here after kickball all the time! The food is good and the beer is grand. It's a small hole-in-the-wall but it is fun.
Great place for sports, shooting pool, playing shuffleboard...you name it!  Just had the chicken Oriental Salad and it was excellent!!

Although I appreciate the new "fresh menu" Dukes is trying to convey I think they missed the mark. I ordered a turkey guacamole sandwich and it came with a choice of sides and I got a salad. The salad came out first which was fine then the sandwich came out and it was just a half a sandwich on a plate. My husband ordered the salmon which was a little salmon strip with mushy broccoli I and rice a roni type rice. 
They need tweak the menu more in order for me to go back. The beer wouldn't draw me in. I can go to another sports bar for that.

Oh what's to say about Duke's that hasn't already been said. I've had some really great times here over the years AND there've been some times that I wish my friends would just let me forget already.

Karaoke, build your own bloody mary, $6 pitchers and rock -n- roll nachos are all part of why I never mind coming here.

One word of caution, though, if you're drinking said $6 pitchers, it's probably flat beer and not too fresh. Often times, you can see a server dipping a straw into the pitcher and briskly giving the beer a stir, causing it to "head" up a bit before bringing it to your table. But it's piss beer anyway, so you pretty much get what you pay for.

My favorite times coming here are during games in which hometown teams are doing well and the owner gives away free shots. Also, the patio is nice during the winter.

Oh yeah, free car ride home if you're too hammered to drive. So please tip the driver!

Cheers!
Good drinks, good food, and overall a good time! Also there is an entire room dedicated to foosball and pool which pretty cool!

Ended up here on a Saturday night after a long day of solid drinking... and it continued nicely here with some karaoke.  I can't speak to the food here because we didn't order any, but the service was solid and the drinks were nice & cold.  

The karaoke host was great and the selection of songs was vast.  I like that they had a couple of books to look at and choose your songs from - sadly the last few times I went it was just luck of the draw whether they had the song you wanted to sing.

I'll be back, and next time I'll try the food!!

Duke Duke Duke 
Duke of Fail
Duke Duke
Duke of Fail

I would say this place was my type of bar 10 years ago, but now in my early 30's I need something more up to date.  This place is huge and has a decent patio.  Table to video games in every room.  Nostalgic sports awards to basic sport memorabilia hangs along the ways with advertisement of alcohol.  Large TV screens here and there with random channels playing.  

I just didn't get a good feel about this place.  Drinks seem pretty affordable here, but the food wasn't too impressive.  We ordered the burger with fries, artichoke dips and jalapeo poppers.  I didn't eat the burger, but the fries were stale.  Ever ate fries that were in the freezer too long and the left in frying oil that needed to be changed?  Yeah it tasted like that.  The artichoke dips seemed like it came out of a box.  It didn't have much taste and the only thing I ate was the tortilla chips.  Finally the poppers were probably the "best" of the night between the dishes.  Nice and creamy once you bit into it and crispy on the outside.  

Overall, serve was good since we were the only large group of people in there.  If you live close by and need a drink I would recommend this place.  However, the immature crowd and poor karaoke music doesn't make we want to stay too long. - Enjoy!

Okay place on the greenbelt.Food is average at best.Drinks are all about a dollar to two dollars more than you would expect to pay in a place like this.Usually crowded with a lot of regulars.Pleasant atmosphere with a patio.Relatively clean place.I like the shuffleboard.The owners name is Al he likes to get drunk and argue with the customers.He likes to talk politics ,worships the Democrat party but oddly most of customers that discussed politics are very conservative.His daughter Jackie runs the day shift she is nothing like her father, always nice to the customers and knows her stuff.Some of the staff is super friendly like Rebecca and Monica others the exact opposite.The one gal that works there is always shooting me looks like she hates me, don't know why for she only waited on me once,I was not rude to her in any way just asked for a beer and left a tip.Lots of TVs,they will try and put your game on.

Totally sufficient for a few rounds of pool or darts while keeping an eye on the 67 tv screens they have mounted on the walls.

Just stick to the cheap pitchers of domestic beer. I ordered a rum and coke and it tasted like cleaning products.
